channel.title: The Occasional
channel.description: The Occasional - brought to you by muzeumist - covers a range of topics dealing with art and art museums.

item.title: Museums at Home, Part I
item.description:
How does an empty museum connect audiences with its exhibitions and/or collections? How does it remain a place of learning and inspiration while its doors are closed?

Museum responses to coronavirus-related closures have taken a number of forms. We’ve gathered a handful of these responses in hopes of providing an engaging and entertaining resource for would-be audiences to enjoy from home. Nothing can replace the experience of visiting these institutions in person. But we’re thankful for the resourceful ways in which they continue to bring art into our homes.

Amsterdam

Still from "Keith Haring Canopy Restoration" minidoc on the Stedelijk website.

Foam

Foam at Home: Sign up to access 50+ magazine editions digitally including many sold-out issues / foam at home

Stedelijk

A selection of minidocs and audio tours about the most-talked-about exhibitions of the past years / Stay at Home Stedelijk]

Van Gogh Museum

Read Van Gogh’s biography, discover the stories about his life and work, and explore his paintings, drawings and letters in the museum’s collection / Van Gogh’s Life and Work

Atlanta

 

Still from a virtual tour of The Life and Death Of Charles Williams on the Atlanta Contemporary website.

Atlanta Contemporary

Virtual tour of the exhibition The Life and Death Of Charles Williams and the current Project Spaces: The End is Near!, Bojana Ginn, LYNX and Kirstin Mitchell / virtual tours

High Museum of Art

Youtube channel featuring collection highlights and arts conversations / High Museum on Youtube

Michael C. Carlos Museum

Virtual exhibitions, activities, podcasts, videos, and more / The Carlos Museum website

Barcelona

 

Soy Cámara on the CCCB website.

Centre de Cultura Contemporània de Barcelona

“Every Friday, we release new chapters of Soy Cámara online, audiovisual capsules about contemporary society’s most pressing issues. Each chapter explores micro-formats and different narrative styles that make us think about the way images are produced in the Internet era. Soy Cámara online also presents the creativity and critical spirit of resourceful audiovisual artistes.” / Soy Cámara

Museu d’Art Contemporani de Barcelona

“One of MACBA’s main roles is to conceive, prepare and arrange content from which new narratives can emerge. Through the Itineraries, we will propose paths that cut across all the content of this website: audio, video, entries on artists, works, texts, publications, exhibitions, etc.” / MACBA Itineraries

Berlin

 

Screenshot from the "Kosmos Hearfield" virtual presentation.

Akademie der Künste

Digital edition of journal der Künste, issue 12 / journal der Künste

Kosmos Heartfield , a virtual presentation that “shows photos, documents and audiovisual material attesting to the life and impact of John Heartfield, the pioneer of photomontage.” / Kosmos Heartfield

KW Institute for Contemporary Art

Hassan Sharif: Exhibition walk-through with curator Krist Gruijthuijsen / on vimeo

BOSTON

 

Screenshot from the "Studio Visit: Tschabalala Self" on the ICA Boston website.

Institute of Contempoary Art Boston

Artist interviews, exhibition videos, performance + film, and more / ICA site

Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

A number of online exhibitions are available on Google Arts & Culture, including László Moholy-Nagy, Radical Geometries (Bauhaus works on paper from the MFA), and Art by African Americans in the MFA / MFA Boston on Google Arts & Culture

BRUSSELS

 

Still from Emily Vey Duke & Cooper Battersby: You Were an Amazement on the Day You Were Born (2019). Now showing on Argos TV.

Argos

“ARGOS TV brings new and old works from the collection to your personal computer, tablet, or smartphone. Each Friday, a film will be made available on our website, up for a week, entirely free of charge.” / Argos TV episode 2

WIELS

Lockdown film program: “carefully selected by our team of curators…which presents the work of artists on display at WIELS or who participated in our residence program.” / The WIELS Vimeo channel

CHICAGO

 

gu wenda, united nations: american code, 1995–2019. Installation view, The Allure of Matter: Material Art from China, Los Angeles County Museum of Art, 2019–20. Photo © Museum Associates/LACMA.

Art Institute of Chicago

Interactive features, including the opportunity to peek under the paint layers of El Greco’s The Assumption of the Virgin, see a West African headdress brought to life through dance, and more / AIC Interactive features

Intuit

A selection of Intuit’s catalogs and essays that “provide information about past Intuit exhibitions, outsider art technique and artist biographies.” / Intuit publications

National Museum of Mexican Art

Tour exhibitions on Google Arts and Culture / exhibition tours

Smart Museum of Art

Original interviews, behind-the-scenes images and videos, and artist profiles from “The Allure of Matter: Material Art from China” / Allure of Matter site

COPENHAGEN

 

Still from Yayoi Kusama: Let’s Fight Together on Lousiana Channel

Copenhagen Contemporary

CC Studio has developed a number of creative activities for families to try at home / activities on Facebook

Louisiana Museum of Modern Art

Louisiana Channel - over 700 videos on art, architecture, literature, and more / Louisiana Channel

National Gallery of Denmark

Browse the SMK collection online. Search by artist or browse by theme / SMK collection

Hirschprung Collection

Tour the museum on Google Arts and Culture tour

Thorvaldsens Museum

Tour the museum on Google Arts and Culture tour

DENVER

 

Clyfford Still, PD-43, 1936. Pen and ink on paper, 11 x 14 inches (27.9 x 35.6 cm). Clyfford Still Museum, Denver, CO.

Denver Art Museum

Beyond Monet Podcast Series: “Stefania Van Dyke, senior interpretive specialist at the Denver Art Museum, shares conversations with non-art experts, who respond to Monet’s work through the lens of their unique expertise.” / on youtube

Browse the collection / Denver Art Museum

Clyfford Still Museum:

Browse the collection / Clyfford Still Museum

DETROIT

 

Still from Jess Johnson and Simon Ward, Umwelt on Daily Rush (Courtesy of the artist and Daata.)

Cranbook Art Museum

Virtual exhibition tours, including Ruth Adler Schnee: Modern Designs for Living, Christy Matson: Crossings, In the Vanguard: Haystack Mountain School of Crafts, 1950-1969, and Landlord Colors: On Art, Economy, and Materiality / virtual tours

Detroit Institute of Arts

Browse the DIA collection online / DIA collection

Museum of Contemporary Art Detroit

Daily Rush, a new media platform “grounded in emerging ideas on digital culture and technology by artists, writers, and curators” / Daily Rush

DUBLIN

 

Works by Mary Farl Powers, installation view, ‘A Fiction Close to Reality’, IMMA, Feb-Oct 2019, Photography Ros Kavanagh

Irish Museum of Modern Art

IMMA Magazine: a wide range of content that includes essays, interviews, digitized catalogs, and more / the magazine

National Gallery of Ireland

Podcasts, essays, ‘meet the staff’ profiles, etc. / National Gallery of Ireland website

HELSINKI

 

Reija Meriläinen: Survivor on Kiasma Online Art

Amos Rex

Video art from the Generation 2020 exhibition / Generation 2020 videos

Ateneum

A series of short films related to the Stories of Finnish Art exhibition / Stories of Finnish Art videos

Kiasma

Kiasma Online Art: “A compendium of topical online works by contemporary artists” / Kiasma Online

HOUSTON

 

Exhibition catalogs from Contemporary Arts Museum Houston available on issuu

Contemporary Arts Museum Houston

Decades of digitized exhibition catalogs / view on issuu

Museum of Fine Arts, Houston

Explore exhibitions on Google Arts and Culture / MFA Houston on Google Arts & Culture

The Menil Collection

Youtube channel with artist conversations, curator lectures, documentaries, collection highlights / The Menil on Youtube

LONDON

 

Old Assyrian letters on cuneiform tablets written around 1900 BC · From 'Trade and contraband in ancient Assyria', an installment in the British Museum's Curator's Corner series

British Museum

Curator’s Corner series: “Curators of the British Museum tell you all about themselves, their research and what it’s like to work with some of the world’s oldest and most significant objects” / Curator’s Corner

Dulwich Picture Gallery

Audio guide to British Surrealism, an exhibition featuring “over 70 eclectic works from 42 artists including Leonora Carrington, Francis Bacon, Henry Moore and Paul Nash as well as lesser known figures such as Marion Adnams, Conroy Maddox, Reuben Mednikoff and Grace Pailthorpe.” / audio guide on Soundcloud

Royal Academy

Artist interviews, curator-led tours, and other videos / RA videos

Serpentine Gallery

Serpentine Online: Collection of online exhibitions, digital commissions, and podcasts / Serpentine Online

LOS ANGELES

 

Still from A Brief History of John Baldessari on the LACMA website

The Broad

Full-length talks from the art talk series and The Un-Private Collection / view on Youtube

Los Angeles County Museum of Art

Short films, exhibition walkthroughs, and documentaries / watch on LACMA site

LACMA-curated music, mixes, and live performances / listen on LACMA site

Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles

The virtual MOCA program includes something for every day of the week, including a book club, movie night, educational program, and more virtual MOCA
